title: The Wall Street Journal: Carlyle Group buys Australia’s Accolade Wines for $772 million
text:
SYDNEY—Private-equity firm The Carlyle Group agreed to buy Australian vintner Accolade Wines Ltd. for 1 billion Australian dollars (US$772 million), gaining a portfolio of popular mass-market brands.
Carlyle is buying the operation from Champ Private Equity, which created Accolade in early 2011 after buying two wine divisions from Constellation Brands Inc. for A$290 million. Constellation has owned 20% of Accolade since that deal and agreed to sell its shares to Carlyle.
